newsitem.title: USA: L.A. temps seen setting record high for second day.
newsitem.headline: L.A. temps seen setting record high for second day.

text.p: Temperatures in downtown Los Angeles were forecast to hit a record high Wednesday after hitting 87 degrees F Tuesday, beating the record of 86 degrees set for that day in 1914.
Local forecasts called for a downtown high of 91 degrees on Wednesday, which would surpass the current record of 89 degrees set several years ago.
A trade source at the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power said Wednesday electricity loads for the city are running almost 10 percent above normal.
Inland desert and valley regions were expected to see temperatures in the mid-90s, he noted.
Weather Services Corp said sunny, mild conditions would likely continue over the next several days as a dome of high pressure parks itself over the Southwest U.S.
Temperatures were forecast to run 10 to 20 degrees above normal through early next week.
